etymologies: late Middle English: from Latin, literally ‘older, older man’, comparative of senex, sen- ‘old man, old’

definitions: of or for older or more experienced people
shortDefinitions: of or for older or more experienced people

definitions: of or for students in the final year of college or high school.
shortDefinitions: of or for students in final year of college or high school

definitions: relating to or denoting competitors of above a certain age or of the highest status in a particular sport.
shortDefinitions: of competitors of above certain age or of highest status in particular sport

definitions: of, for, or denoting schoolchildren above a certain age, typically eleven.
shortDefinitions: of, for, or denoting schoolchildren above certain age

definitions: (in names) denoting the elder of two who have the same name in a family, especially a father as distinct from his son
shortDefinitions: denoting elder of two who have same name in family

definitions: holding a high and authoritative position

examples.text: he is a senior Finance Ministry official
the people senior to me in my department

definitions: a person who is a specified number of years older than someone else

examples.text: she was only two years his senior

shortDefinitions: person who is specified number of years older than someone else

definitions: an elderly person, especially one who is retired and living on a pension

examples.text: the price is $7 for adults and $3.50 for seniors

definitions: a student in the final year of college or high school

examples.text: among the pupils was a senior, a boy of about seventeen

shortDefinitions: student in one of higher forms of senior school

definitions: a student in a school for older children, especially those eleven and over.
shortDefinitions: student in school for older children

definitions: a competitor of above a certain age or of the highest status in a particular sport

examples.text: at fourteen you move up to the seniors

shortDefinitions: competitor of above certain age or of highest status in particular sport
